meanings.definition: To feel contempt or a deep repugnance for.
meanings.sent1: I despise the taste of broccoli.
meanings.sent2: She despises people who are mean to animals.
meanings.sent3: Even the cat seems to despise the new brand of cat food.
meanings.sent4: His actions made me despise him more than ever.
meanings.sent5: The thought of eating bugs made her despise the idea of camping.

meanings.definition: To regard with scorn or disdain.
meanings.sent1: The bully despises anyone who is different from him.
meanings.sent2: They despise the idea of cheating in a competition.
meanings.sent3: I can't help but despise the way he chews his food loudly.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes seemed to despise me as I walked past.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's stern look made the students despise breaking the rules.
